item.title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 14 (Updated Live): The Allu Arjun starrer expected to remain steady - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Day 14: Allu Arjun Starrer Crosses Rs 950 Crore

Publication Date: December 6, 2023
Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2' has broken numerous records since its release and is projected to cross Rs 1000 crore net at the domestic box office in the coming days, having already surpassed this figure worldwide.

  • The film's Day 14 collection so far is Rs 9.64 crore, with expectations to reach Rs 20 crore by the end of the day.
  • Total domestic collection to date is Rs 962.04 crore.
  • Despite a dip in Monday's earnings, the film performed strongly over the weekend.
  • The upcoming holiday period may boost numbers further.
'Pushpa 2' made Rs 26.95 crore on Monday and Rs 23.35 crore on Tuesday.

As the holiday season approaches, the film is expected to draw larger crowds, despite potential competition from 'Baby John' released during Christmas.

item.title: Activist claims that Abujhmad encounter was fake, four children injured - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Activist Claims Abujhmad Encounter Was Fake; Four Children Injured

Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Activists and villagers in Abujhmad allege that seven individuals killed by police were not Maoists but local villagers, with four children injured during the incident.

  • Activists claim that five of the seven killed were villagers working in fields.
  • Four children sustained serious injuries and reportedly did not receive medical help for three days.
  • Police deny the claims, stating that the children were used as human shields by Maoists.
  • The incident occurred in the villages of Kummam and Lekawada under Rekhawaya Panchayat, Narayanpur district.
  • Human rights activists express concern over the ongoing incidents affecting tribal children in the region.
“The deaths and injuries of tribal children in this ongoing campaign by security forces in Bastar should alarm the nation.” - Rinchin, Human Rights Activist

The incident has raised serious concerns over police conduct and the safety of villagers in the ongoing conflict with Maoists.

item.title: Two soldiers die while loading ammunition during training exercise in Bikaner - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tragic Incident Claims Lives of Two Soldiers During Training in Bikaner

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Two soldiers of the Indian Army tragically died due to an explosion while loading ammunition during a training exercise in Bikaner.

  • The incident occurred at Mahajan field firing range.
  • A sudden explosion happened as soldiers were loading ammunition, resulting in two fatalities and one serious injury.
  • The deceased soldiers are Ashutosh Mishra from Deoria and Jitendra from Dausa.
  • This marks the second fatal incident in the Bikaner range within days.
  • A court of inquiry has been initiated to investigate the cause of the explosion.
“The charger exploded while the soldiers were loading the ammunition,” said the defence spokesperson.

This sad occurrence highlights the risks associated with military training exercises and has led to renewed calls for safety measures.

item.title: Updated World Test Championship Table After India vs Australia Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Updated World Test Championship Table After India vs Australia Brisbane Test Ends In A Draw

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: NDTV

India secured a vital draw against Australia in the rain-affected third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, keeping the series level at 1-1.

  • Both teams saw their WTC points percentages dip, with India now at 55.88% and Australia at 58.89%.
  • South Africa leads the standings with a 63.33% PCT and is well-positioned for the WTC final in June 2025.
  • India must win both remaining Tests against Australia to stay in contention for the final.
  • The outcome of matches involving Sri Lanka will also influence India's chances of qualification.
If India wins each of the remaining Tests, their PCT could rise to 60.52, surpassing Australia even with a 2-0 victory against Sri Lanka.

In conclusion, India’s path to the WTC final requires winning both Tests against Australia, while relying on external results to bolster their chances.

item.title: Breaking | Umar Khalid Gets 7 Days Interim Bail In Delhi Riots Larger Conspiracy Case - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Umar Khalid Granted 7 Days Interim Bail in Delhi Riots Case

Publication Date: January 3, 2025   Source: Indian Courts

A Delhi Court has granted interim bail to Umar Khalid for a week, allowing him to attend a family wedding amidst allegations related to the 2020 North-East Delhi riots. The bail comes with several conditions aimed at ensuring compliance during this period.

  • The bail is valid for 7 days.
  • Khalid must not contact any witness or individuals connected to the case.
  • He is prohibited from using social media during this timeframe.
  • Meetings are restricted to family and friends, and he must remain at home or wedding venues.

Khalid is required to surrender by the evening of January 3, 2025. His previous bail application had been rejected, leading to ongoing legal proceedings.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin retirement reactions LIVE: Virat Kohli shares emotional note; ‘Had a long journey together since 2010,’ says Rohit Sharma - The Hindu
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin retirement reactions LIVE: Virat Kohli shares emotional note; ‘Had a long journey together since 2010,’ says Rohit Sharma

Published: December 18, 2024, Source: The Hindu

India’s key spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket on December 18, 2024, following the third Test match of the Border-Gavaskar series against Australia.

  • Ashwin is the second-fastest player to achieve 500 Test wickets, reaching this milestone in 98 matches.
  • Throughout his career, he has taken 765 wickets and holds 37 five-wicket hauls.
  • Notable reactions include heartfelt messages from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, highlighting the impact Ashwin had on their careers.
“I’ve played with you for 14 years and when you told me today you’re retiring, it made me a bit emotional.” - Virat Kohli

The cricket community pays tribute to Ashwin's remarkable contributions to the sport.

item.title: ‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court affirmed that its doors are open to the protesting farmers after they rejected discussions with a Punjab government committee.

  • The court emphasized that farmers can directly present their demands.
  • The Punjab government reported ongoing efforts to engage with farmer leaders.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key farmer leader, is on a hunger strike, pressing for a legal guarantee of Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
  • The Supreme Court noted the health concerns of Dallewal and instructed medical assistance from the Punjab government.
“We clarify that court's doors are always open to any suggestion or demand by farmers directly or through their authorised representative.”

This situation highlights the ongoing tension between the Punjab farmers and the state government, with the Supreme Court offering a potential avenue for resolution.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to be part of simultaneous polls JPC: Sources - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to join JPC for simultaneous polls

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress party leaders are expected to participate in a Joint Parliamentary Committee to evaluate the introduction of legislation for simultaneous elections.

  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and other Congress MPs are likely to represent the party.
  • The bills concerning simultaneous elections were introduced in Lok Sabha after significant debate.
  • Opposition groups have expressed concerns, labeling the legislation as anti-constitutional.
  • Support for the legislation comes from 32 political parties, while 15 oppose it.
  • Amit Shah announced that the bill would be handed over to a JPC for further discussion.
“It is against the federalism of our nation. We are opposing the bill,” said Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

The deliberations in the JPC will be vital as the government aims to push through the simultaneous election legislation amid differing opinions within the political landscape.

item.title: NASA alert! Giant 84-foot asteroid 2024 XS3 to pass Earth today; will the asteroid collide? - The Times of India
item.description:
NASA Alert: Giant 84-Foot Asteroid 2024 XS3 Passes Earth Safely

Date: December 18, 2024   Source: Times of India

Today, the Apollo NEO asteroid, 2024 XS3, will safely pass Earth at a distance of approximately 3.3 million kilometers. Discovered on December 3, 2024, it poses no collision risk.

  • The asteroid follows an elliptical orbit with a perihelion of 0.89 AU and an aphelion of 2.58 AU.
  • It is part of the Apollo asteroid group, taking approximately 833 days to complete one revolution around the Sun.
  • Scientists assure that after today, 2024 XS3 won't come closer than 45 million kilometers until 2027.
  • Asteroids like 2024 XS3 hold vital information about the solar system's formation.
  • NASA monitors Near-Earth Objects using advanced radar systems to track potential threats.
  • Ongoing efforts include missions aimed to detect and deflect hazardous asteroids.
"Asteroid 2024 XS3 serves as a reminder of the importance of asteroid monitoring and planetary defense."

In conclusion, while this encounter presents no threat, it highlights the ongoing need for monitoring of NEOs to ensure Earth's safety from future cosmic dangers.

item.title: NASA alert: 84-foot asteroid to pass close to Earth today - The Times of India
item.description:
NASA Alert: 84-Foot Asteroid to Pass Close to Earth Today

Date: Today

Source: NASA

This article discusses the close approach of an 84-foot asteroid to Earth, highlighting its proximity and any potential implications for our planet.

  • NASA has issued an alert regarding the close passage of the asteroid.
  • The asteroid measures approximately 84 feet in diameter.
  • This event occurs today, with minimal risk to Earth.
"NASA monitors near-Earth objects to ensure the safety of the planet."

The passage of this asteroid serves as a reminder of the importance of monitoring celestial objects that come close to Earth.

item.title: OnePlus 13, OnePlus 13R India Launch Date Officially Confirmed; Check Expected Specs, Price - Zee News
item.description:
OnePlus 13, OnePlus 13R India Launch Date Officially Confirmed

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Zee News

The OnePlus 13 series, including the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, is set to launch globally with a special event in India.

  • The launch event will commence at 9:00 pm IST on January 7, 2025, coinciding with OnePlus's 11th anniversary.
  • The smartphones will be available via Amazon and OnePlus India e-store.
  • Globally, the OnePlus 13 has already been released in China.
  • The expected price for OnePlus 13 is around Rs 65,000.
  • Specifications include a 6.82-inch Quad-HD+ AMOLED display, Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC, and a triple camera setup.
“The event will be live-streamed on OnePlus’s official channels.”

For more updates, stay tuned to official sources regarding the OnePlus 13 series.

item.title: Tech News Today Live Updates on December 18, 2024: POCO M7 Pro 5G smartphone first impressions: Budget segment, redefined! | Mint - Mint
item.description:
POCO M7 Pro 5G smartphone first impressions: Budget segment, redefined!

Date: 18 Dec, 2024 Source: LiveMint

The POCO M7 Pro 5G promises to redefine the budget smartphone segment by offering premium features at an affordable price.

  • The POCO M7 Pro 5G features a 120Hz AMOLED display, a 50MP camera, and powerful performance under ₹17,000.
  • The article discusses the growing importance of staying informed about technological advancements affecting consumers and industries.
“In an era dominated by rapid technological evolution, staying informed with the latest technology news is essential.”

This smartphone aims to deliver flagship-like features to budget-conscious consumers, impacting the smartphone market significantly.

item.title: Rohit Sharma gives big update on Mohammed Shami’s availability for remaining two Australia Tests - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Provides Update on Mohammed Shami's Availability for Australia Tests

Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian captain Rohit Sharma has shared important details regarding pacer Mohammed Shami's potential participation in the final two Tests against Australia, expressing the need for updates from the National Cricket Academy.

  • Rohit emphasizes the importance of ensuring Shami's fitness for the remaining Tests.
  • Shami is currently in rehabilitation after ankle surgery and needs clearance from the NCA.
  • The third Test ended in a draw, making the series tied at 1-1.
  • The next match will be held at the MCG starting December 26.
“The last thing you want is the player coming here and then pulling out in the middle of the game.” - Rohit Sharma

The Indian team management is keen on Shami's return but will only consider it upon receiving confirmation from the NCA regarding his fitness.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal announces new health scheme for Delhi's elderly population - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Introduces Health Scheme for Elderly in Delhi Ahead of Elections

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), announced a new health scheme called 'Sanjeevani Yojana' for elderly citizens in Delhi, promising free treatment in government and private hospitals.

  • The scheme is aimed at citizens over 60 years old.
  • There will be no upper limit on the cost of treatment.
  • Registration will begin shortly with AAP workers assisting at home.
  • The scheme will be implemented once AAP wins the upcoming elections.
“There are a lot of errors in the central government's scheme and Delhi government has launched a better scheme correcting those errors,” said Delhi Minister Saurabh Bhardwaj.

This announcement follows a face-off with the BJP regarding the implementation of the Central government's Aayushmaan Bharat scheme.

In conclusion, this move is part of AAP's strategy to capitalize on healthcare issues ahead of elections, promising enhanced support for seniors.

item.title: OpenAI challenges Google: ChatGPT Search now free for all users - India TV News
item.description:
OpenAI Challenges Google: ChatGPT Search Now Free for All Users

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

OpenAI, one of the most popular chatbot's founding companies has intensified competition with Google by making its ChatGPT Search feature free. This AI-powered search engine is now accessible to all users, promising to revolutionize online search.

  • ChatGPT Search, launched in November 2024, was initially for paid users only.
  • The feature is now free, positioning it as a direct competitor to Google.
  • It offers a user-friendly interface with direct answers and sources for queries.
  • OpenAI has introduced advanced voice mode for hands-free operation.
  • A map feature has been integrated, allowing users to locate nearby places.
  • Continuous updates aim to enhance user experience and functionality.
“The free availability of ChatGPT Search…could significantly disrupt the dominance of traditional search engines like Google.”

This move by OpenAI represents a significant shift in the online search landscape, potentially offering users a fresh alternative to traditional search engines.

item.title: On 'Starlink' device used by militants in Manipur, Elon Musk says 'beams are turned off over India' - The Times of India
item.description:
On 'Starlink' device used by militants in Manipur, Elon Musk says 'beams are turned off over India'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Elon Musk addressed the use of Starlink technology in Manipur, stating that the satellite beams are turned off over India, highlighting concerns about its potential misuse.

  • The Starlink satellites offer internet access but are restricted in India.
  • Musk's comments come amid ongoing conflicts in the region.
  • The use of such technology by militants raises security concerns.
“Beams are turned off over India,” said Musk, indicating a critical stance on the technology's use in conflict areas.

This incident underscores the tension between technology use and national security in volatile regions.

item.title: Fed set to deliver 3rd rate cut and Honda Nissan merger - what’s moving markets - Investing.com
item.description:
Fed Set to Deliver 3rd Rate Cut and Honda Nissan Merger - What’s Moving Markets

Date: December 13, 2023 | Source: Investing.com

The Federal Reserve is expected to announce its third consecutive rate cut, while Honda and Nissan are in discussions about a potential merger amid various market movements.

  • The Fed is likely to cut rates by 25 basis points, with further cuts anticipated in January due to labor market softness.
  • US stock futures edged higher, preparing for the Fed's final decision of the year.
  • Oil prices showed mixed results as traders awaited the Fed's announcement and assessed the impacts of new sanctions on Russia.
  • Honda and Nissan are exploring a merger as they face challenges in the electric vehicle sector.
  • Bitcoin experienced profit-taking after reaching record highs ahead of the Fed's decision.
"Our baseline forecast is that it cuts again on 29 January, because we expect the incoming labour market data to soften further," stated analysts at Standard Chartered.

In conclusion, the Fed's rate decision is widely watched, and the potential merger between Honda and Nissan highlights significant trends in the automotive industry.

item.title: "He is a feisty character and we need such guys in the team": Rohit Sharma praises India's newest match saver against Australia - Crictoday
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Praises Akash Deep for His Match-Saving Performance Against Australia

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

The third Test between India and Australia ended in a draw due to rain interruptions. Australia dominated most of the match, but a standout innings from Akash Deep helped India avoid the follow-on. Rohit Sharma praised Akash in a press conference following the match.

  • India needed 33 runs to avoid the follow-on when Akash and Jasprit Bumrah were batting.
  • Akash scored 31 runs off 44 balls, helping India reach 260 runs.
  • Rohit Sharma praised Akash, saying, "He always gives 100 percent and is a spicy character. We want such guys in the team."
“He always gives 100 percent and is a spicy character. We want such guys in the team, who can contribute in all the departments.” - Rohit Sharma

The match ended with Australia declaring their second innings at 89/7, leaving India with a target of 275 runs, but rain interrupted the play.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi To Be Part Of House Panel On 'One Nation, One Poll': Sources - NDTV
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi To Be Part Of House Panel On 'One Nation, One Poll': Sources

Date: November 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Priyanka Gandhi and Manish Tewari are nominated to study the 'one nation, one election' Constitution Amendment Bill, which proposes simultaneous elections in India.

  • Priyanka Gandhi and Manish Tewari are among Congress nominees for the panel.
  • The bill was introduced amid opposition protests regarding its implications on federalism.
  • The BJP is likely to lead the committee, which will consist of a maximum of 31 members.
  • The panel has an initial period of 90 days to submit its report.
  • The Constitution amendment proposes changes to allow simultaneous federal and state elections.
“This move directly challenges the federal nature of the country... by imposing uniformity across states.” - Manish Tewari

The upcoming committee discussions are crucial as they will address concerns about the federal structure and the integrity of diverse state elections in India.

item.title: PM Modi supports Amit Shah, says ‘Congress’s lies cannot hide its insults to Ambedkar, our reverence for him absolute’ - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Defends Amit Shah Against Congress Insults to Ambedkar

Published: December 18, 2024 02:13 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

In a robust defense of Amit Shah, Prime Minister Modi refuted Congress' claims of insults to B.R. Ambedkar, asserting that Shah exposed the party’s historical disrespect towards the Constitution’s architect.

  • Modi emphasized that Congress is trying to obscure their history of insults to Ambedkar.
  • The Prime Minister accused the Congress of using theatrics to distract from the facts presented by Shah.
  • Mr. Modi mentioned the longstanding issues faced by Ambedkar’s legacy under Congress rule.
  • He cited various government initiatives that align with Ambedkar's vision for social justice.
  • Protests occurred in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha related to the controversy.
“They can try as they want but they can't deny that the worst massacres against SC/ST Communities have happened under their regimes.” - PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks highlight ongoing tensions between the BJP and Congress, focusing particularly on historical narratives surrounding prominent leaders like Ambedkar.

item.title: Aamir Khan Productions breaks silence over ‘Laapataa Ladies’ Oscars 2025 snub - The Hindu
item.description:
Aamir Khan Productions Reacts to 'Laapataa Ladies' Oscars 2025 Snub

Published: December 18, 2024, Source: The Hindu

Aamir Khan Productions has issued an official statement following the exclusion of Laapataa Ladies from the Oscars 2025 shortlist for Best International Feature Film. The Film Federation of India’s decision to bypass the Kiran Rao-directed satire sparked significant backlash among cinephiles and industry figures alike.

  • The film, which critiques the patriarchy in rural India, was critically acclaimed but not shortlisted for the Oscars.
  • Aamir Khan Productions expressed disappointment but emphasized gratitude for the support received.
  • The statement highlighted the honor of being considered among the finest films globally, despite the snub.
  • Critics have raised concerns about the selection criteria of the Film Federation of India.
  • The situation has drawn attention back to Payal Kapadia’s Cannes-winning film, All We Imagine As Light, viewed as India’s strongest contender.
“Laapataa Ladies did not make it to the Academy Awards shortlist this year, and we are of course disappointed, but equally we are immensely grateful for the incredible support and belief we’ve received throughout this journey.”

The exclusion of Laapataa Ladies adds another chapter to India’s contentious history with the Academy Awards.

item.title: What does Brisbane draw against Australia mean for India's WTC final chances - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What does Brisbane draw against Australia mean for India's WTC final chances

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The draw at the Gabba keeps India in the third spot of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with a PCT of 58.88 after 17 matches. Persistent rain forced the match to conclude in a draw, impacting India's chances for the WTC final.

  • The match ended in a draw due to rain after India began their chase of 275 runs.
  • India cannot afford another draw or loss in their remaining two matches to stay in contention for the WTC final.
  • Winning 3-1 in the remaining series would ensure India's qualification without depending on other results.
  • The draw maintains tight competition in the WTC standings, with Australia and South Africa also in contention.
The draw did keep India still in the hunt for a spot in the WTC final, but they have now entered a must-win territory.

Overall, while India remains in contention for the World Test Championship final, they must secure victories in their upcoming matches to guarantee qualification.
